conclusion: Liquid flows out from points A, B, C, and D at the top.

Point A is located at the top left, point B is slightly to the right of A, point C is further to the right, and point D is at the top right. Containers E and F are located at the bottom left and bottom right respectively.
Baffles are angled barriers placed between the top points and the containers, directing the flow of liquid.
Liquid from point A flows down the leftmost path, hits a baffle, and is directed towards the left.
Liquid from point B flows down and is directed towards the right due to the baffle.
Liquid from point C flows down the center, encounters a baffle, and is directed towards the right.
Liquid from point D flows down the rightmost path and is directed towards the right by the baffle.
Liquids from A and B are directed towards the left container (E).
Liquids from C and D are directed towards the right container (F).
Container E receives liquid from A and B, and container F receives liquid from C and D.
